alert.note: Alert for Washington (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 03 at 2:23PM CST until February 03 at 3:45PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: The National Weather Service in New Orleans has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Washington Parish in southeastern Louisiana... Northwestern Pearl River County in southern Mississippi... * Until 345 PM CST. * At 223 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Bogalusa, Varnado, Crossroads and Angie. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 59 in Mississippi near mile marker 42. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
